author: Special Correspondent
text:
The city police have placed under suspension head constable Gnanasekaran, attached to Special Intelligence Cell (SIC), for his alleged involvement in two cases of extortion in the city.

Police sources said that Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav ordered the suspension of the head constable based on an enquiry report submitted by S.S. Colony police that confirmed his involvement in the extortion cases.

The police said that Gnanasekaran was the brain behind the incident of extorting a hotelier in Arasaradi and the Regional Transport Officer (South).

When the police rounded up three persons involved in threatening the hotelier, one among them, Prem, claimed that Gnanasekaran had guided them to cheat the hotelier.

Based on his confession, the police made him call Gnanasekaran claiming that he had got the money (Rs. 1 lakh) that they demanded from the hotelier.

The police took the accused to Palanganatham junction where Gnanasekaran had reportedly asked them to meet him.

In other case too, the head constable was said to have drafted the petition against the RTO, the police said.
title: Head constable suspended
